titleStmt.title: The Pretensions of the most Christian King to the dominions & territories of the most serene confederates on the one side, and on the other, the claims of the most serene confederates with exact enquiries into the rights of every one in particular / from the French original.

notesStmt.note: "Affording great light into the present differences of Europe and proper to be bound up with The historical and political Mercury."
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
